pddl4j.preprocessing

Class CodedProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • pddl4j.preprocessing.CodedProblem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CodedProblem
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class implements a problem where operators are instantiated and encoded in BitSet representation.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Create a new CodedProblem copy of another.

      • getRelevantOperators

        public java.util.List<BitOp> getRelevantOperators(int taskIndex)
        Compute the relevant operators for a specified task. An operator is relevant if and only if:
        • the operator has the same name as the task and
        • the same parameters.
        Parameters:
        taskIndex - the index of the task.
        Returns:
        the list of operators relevant for the task in parameter.

      • getRelevantMethods

        public java.util.List<OrderedMethod> getRelevantMethods(int taskIndex)
        Compute the relevant methods for a specified task. A method is relevant if and only if:
        • the method has the same name as the task and
        • the same parameters.
        Parameters:
        taskIndex - the index of the task.
        Returns:
        the list of methods relevant for the task in parameter.

      • getIndexOfConstraint

        public int getIndexOfConstraint(int[] constraint)
        Returns the index of a specified constraint. (The index of the first task * The size of the tasks table) + The index of the second task
        Parameters:
        constraint - the table of constraints indexes.
        Returns:
        the index of the constraints.

        Parameters:

      • getAbsoluteIndex

        public int getAbsoluteIndex(int task)
        Calculate the reference index for a task. It corresponds to the index of the task in the relevant tasks table
        Parameters:
        task - The task for which we search the reference index
        Returns:
        The reference index for the specified task
